question.qText: Which of the following is evidence that a chemical reaction occurs between sodium metal and chlorine gas?
Which of the following is evidence that a chemical reaction occurs between hydrogen and oxygen gases?
Which of the following reactions would best be classified as a synthesis reaction?

aBtn.aText: SrO + SO<font face='SubScript'>2</font> <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> SrSO<font face='SubScript'>3</font>

H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>SO<font face='SubScript'>4</font> + Ca(NO<font face='SubScript'>3</font>)<font face='SubScript'>2</font> <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> CaSO<font face='SubScript'>4</font> + 2HNO<font face='SubScript'>3</font>
PCl<font face='SubScript'>3</font> + 3H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>O <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> H<font face='SubScript'>3</font>PO<font face='SubScript'>3</font> + 3HCl
ZnCO<font face='SubScript'>3</font> <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> ZnO + CO<font face='SubScript'>2</font>

question.qText: Which of the following synthesis reactions is also a redox reaction?

aBtn.aText: SrO + SO<font face='SubScript'>2</font> <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> SrSO<font face='SubScript'>3</font>

P<font face='SubScript'>2</font>O<font face='SubScript'>5</font> + 3H<font face='SubScript'>2</font>O <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> 2H<font face='SubScript'>3</font>PO<font face='SubScript'>4</font>
BH<font face='SubScript'>3</font> + PCl<font face='SubScript'>3</font> <font face='CambriaMath'>→</font> H<font face='SubScript'>3</font>BPCl<font face='SubScript'>3</font>
